isis.stitle: HOOD, GRILLE AND FENDERS - 2000, 4000, 8000 - ADJUSTMENTS - HOOD

svcprocinfo.para: Improper positioning of the hood relative to the cab can cause the tilt mechanism to malfunction and can interfere with engine components.
The front of the hood is to be at the proper height, which will allow a parallel gap between the bottom front edge of the hood and the bumper.
The hood is to be centered so the clearances for the radiator and air intake box-to-splash panels and shock absorbers are adequate.

Before adjusting the hood, be sure the chassis is on a level surface and the hood is mounted properly to the cab. Adjust the radiator-to-cowl dimension for 2000, 4000 and 8000 series vehicles as follows.

Perform the following procedure for a new hood installation, or for a hood that has been removed and re-installed, to assure that the hood is positioned correctly relative to the cab, front bumper and radiator.

svcsubproc.para: To adjust the right and left side hood hinges (Item 1) forward or back (Item 2) to meet the hood-to-cowl 1/2 inch spacing specification, use the following procedure, passenger side shown.

step1.para: Make 2 wood spacer blocks that are sized 1/2 x 1.0 x 24.0 inch (12.7 x 25.4 x 609.6 mm).

With the hood closed and latched, try to place the 2 hood-to-cowl spacer blocks on top of the cowl flange (Figure 72) between the hood and cowl. If the hood needs adjustment to allow the spacer blocks to fit between the hood and cowl or to make the hood rest against the front of the spacer blocks, adjust as follows.
Release the hood latches on each side of the hood and tilt the hood assembly to full open position.
Position the 2 hood-to-cowl spacer blocks on the cowl flange ( Figure 73).

step1.para: Loosen (to finger tight), but do not remove, the 2 hinge plate bracket flanged hex bolts and hex lock nuts (Item 1) and push the hood forward (Item 2) at both hinge plate brackets (Item 3), passenger side shown.

Carefully close the hood so the rear edge of the hood rests against the front of the hood-to-cowl spacer blocks. Make sure the spacer blocks are equally spaced and are sitting on the cowl flange, then latch the hood on both sides.

If the hood cannot be closed with the rear edge of the hood resting against the front of the hood-to-cowl spacer blocks and latched, it may be necessary to lower the hood downward (Item 4) at both lower hinge plates (Item 6), refer to 2500 and 2600 Hood Adjustment Up or Down at the Lower Hinge Plate (Original Hood).

With the hood-to-cowl dimension properly set, tighten the 2 hinge plate bracket flanged hex bolts and hex lock nuts (Item 1) at each hinge plate bracket (Item 3), passenger side shown. Tighten to 110 to 120 ft-lbs. (149 to 163 Nm).
Release the hood latches on each side of the hood and tilt the hood assembly and remove the hood-to-cowl spacer blocks from the cowl flange.
Close and latch the hood on both sides.

With the hood closed and latched, try to place the 2 hood-to-cowl spacer blocks on top of the cowl flange ( Figure 73) between the hood and cowl. If the hood needs adjustment to allow the spacer blocks to fit between the hood and cowl or to make the hood rest against the front of the spacer blocks, adjust as follows.
Release the hood latches on each side of the hood and tilt the hood assembly to full open position.
Position the 2 hood-to-cowl spacer blocks on the cowl flange.

Loosen (to finger tight), but do not remove, the 2 hinge yoke hex bolts (Item 4) at both hinge yokes and hinge yoke brackets (Items 5 and 6) and push the hood forward and down (Items 2 and 3), passenger side shown.

Carefully close the hood so the rear edge of the hood rests against the front of the hood-to-cowl spacer blocks. Make sure the spacer blocks are equally spaced and are sitting on the cowl flange, then latch the hood on both sides.

With the hood resting against the hood-to-cowl spacer blocks and the hood latched on both sides. Make sure the bottom front edge of the hood is parallel to the line of the bumper, then tighten the 2 hinge yoke hex bolts (Item 4) at each hinge yoke and hinge yoke bracket (Items 5 and 6), passenger side shown. Tighten to 75 to 85 ft-lbs. (102 to 115 Nm).
Release the hood latches on each side of the hood and tilt the hood assembly and remove the hood-to-cowl spacer blocks from the cowl flange.
Close and latch the hood on both sides.

svcsubproc.para: To adjust the right and left side hood hinges (Item 1) up or down (Item 2) to make the bottom front edge of the hood parallel with the line of the bumper, use the following procedure.

step1.para: Make 2 wood spacer blocks that are sized 1/2 x 1.0 x 24.0 inch (12.7 x 25.4 x 609.6 mm).
Release the hood latches on each side of the hood and tilt the hood assembly to the full open position.
Loosen (to finger tight), but do not remove, the 4 upper hinge reinforcement hex nuts (Item 3) at both upper hinge reinforcements (Item 4), driver side shown.
Place the 2 hood-to-cowl spacer blocks on top of the cowl flange ( Figure 73) between the hood and cowl. This will keep the hood-to-cowl spacing during the up or down adjustment.

Carefully close the hood so the rear edge of the hood rests against the front of the hood-to-cowl spacer blocks. Make sure the spacer blocks are equally spaced and are sitting on the cowl flange, then latch the hood on both sides.

If the hood needs adjustment to allow the spacer blocks to fit between the hood and cowl or to make the hood rest against the front of the spacer blocks, refer to 8200 Hood Adjustment Forward or Back at the Lower Hinge Plate Bracket.

With the hood resting against the hood-to-cowl spacer blocks and the hood latched on both sides. Push the hood up or down (Item 2) at both upper hinge reinforcements (Item 4), as required, to make the bottom front edge of the hood parallel with the line of the bumper, driver side shown.

With the bottom front edge of the hood parallel with the line of the bumper, tighten the 2 outboard upper hinge reinforcement hex nuts (Item 3) at each upper hinge reinforcement (Item 4) so the hood does not move when raised.

Release the hood latches on each side of the hood and tilt the hood assembly to the full open position. Tighten the 4 upper hinge reinforcement hex nuts (Item 3) at each upper hinge reinforcement (Item 4). Tighten to 34 to 38 ft-lbs. (46 to 51 Nm).
Remove the hood-to-cowl spacer blocks from the cowl flange and close and latch the hood on both sides.
